title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When performing a revert operation in the Java editor, it takes significantly longer compared to the close and reopen method.
OB: When opening an editor for the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, and marking the file as dirty by inserting a space character at the end of the first line, the following behavior is observed: Clicking on the close box in the editor tab prompts a 'do you want to save changes' dialog. Selecting 'no' in the dialog. Double-clicking on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
EB: The revert operation in the editor should complete within a reasonable timeframe, similar to or faster than the close and reopen method.
SR:
1. Open the editor for the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2. Insert a space character at the end of the first line to mark the file as dirty.
3. Click on the close box in the editor tab.
4. In the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, select 'no'.
5. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
6. Observe the time taken for the revert operation.
